definition: residence/(coll.) to stay in at home/to hang around at home

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: He led the way across the spongy yard to a row of hedges that fronted the elegant house.
sentences.chinese: 他走着橫穿過柔軟的院子到這優雅宅子前的那排樹籬。

sentences.english: I shook my head and turned right at Coddington Terrace by the Holders' old house.
sentences.chinese: 我搖着腦袋，轉過身對着屋主的舊宅子旁的科丁頓道。

sentences.english: So you mean to enter this house?
The rich man lived in a splendid house.
sentences.chinese: 那個富翁住在豪華的宅子裏。

sentences.english: It is wild, and humid all year around in this old house.
sentences.chinese: 這間老宅子一年四季都是溫溼的。

sentences.english: One brother and sister visiting the Hall watched a cloaked apparition for fifteen minutes.
sentences.chinese: 一對遊覽過宅子的兄妹曾看到一件斗篷飛了15分鐘。

sentences.english: People say ghosts haunt that old house.
sentences.chinese: 據說那座老宅子有鬼魂出沒。

definition: courtyard house with a fully enclosed courtyard (type of Chinese residence)
